title: Given the following equation: Fe2O3 + 3 C → 2 Fe + 3 CO, how many grams of Fe are formed when 15 mol of Fe2O3 reacts? - Quora

response.answer_text: From the balanced equation: 1mol Fe2O3 will produce 2 mol Fe 15mol Fe2O3 will produce 15*2 = 30 mol Fe Molar mass Fe = 55.85g/mol Mass of 30 mol Fe = 30mol * 55.85g/mol = 1,675.5g Answer should have only 2 significant digits : 1700g
